either moral thing action habit natural toad vent poiſon honey ſo man ſinneth natural inabled thing good wholly grace ſay inward principle ſinne within u diſtinguiſh external cauſe viz devil wicked men ſometimes may tempt cauſe ſinne therefore devil called tempter mat 4 3 inſomuch made queſtion whether ſinne man commits devil hath tempted unto attend time enough devil outward cauſe ſinne therefore original filth u ſparks could never kindle fire cannot compell force ſinne ſomuch whatſoever ſinne commit lay fault principally upon devil corrupt heart though ananias lied againſt holy ghoſt becauſe devil filled heart juda betrayed chriſt becauſe satan entred heart yet devil could come heart uncleane corrupt conſtitutions evil heart therefore devil took poſſeſſion apoſtle james cap 1 14 doth notably diſcover true cauſe natural fountain evil committed u luſt concupiſcence within u ſaith muſt charge god ſinnes blamed becauſe kept wickedneſs neither doth bid u charge upon devil though doth tempt u upon corrupt luſt within thus ſee paul ſaith thoſe chriſt longer live chriſt within gal 2 20 may contrary affirm every man nature doth ſo much live ſinne within phyſical nature cauſeth u think ſpeak alſo ſinne like moral nature doth make u think ſpeak ſinfully even lame horſe never move himſelf go halteth motion surely conſideration ſhould make mankind mourn ſackcloth roll ſelf aſhes ſhould man whole life anſelm ſaid deplore whole life totâ vitâ totam vitam deplorare cannot move ſtirre thing ſinneth cateth drinketh worketh yea prayeth theſe ſinneth ſhewed ſee becauſe original ſinne way principle within u irregular motion therefore though devil tempt example men imitate yet corrupt nature within would carry cain murder abel ſuch ſinne world many time wonder child yea ſometimes grown men ſhould commit ſuch ſinnes could ſee practiſed eye need wonder conſider ſhop impiety every man heart nature hence solomon ſpeaking uprightneſs god made man eccleſ 7 29 naturality devil wickedneſs ſaith ſinneth john 8 44 ſpeaketh lie ſpeaketh thou art proud worldly unbelieving thou doeſt thy wonder ſome lie ſo ready hand excuſe iniquity even young child like devil ſo ſinne call wealth life theſe god propenſity ſinne ariſeth ſelves rotten tree come thoſe worm conſume oh deep humiliation ſhould cauſe thee thou haſt nothing thou canſt call thy ſinne god hateth loatheth thine looketh thee ſeeth thy ſoul gave thee ſeeth thy body workmanſhip alſo beholdeth pravity ſinfull diſpoſition thee none god came adam diſobedience ſo ſinne wonder devil tempt example imitate yet men readily commit ſinne sect iv thirdly ſinne natural becauſe doth alwayes conſtantly put ſelf forth one way diſcovering naturality thing viz alwayes conſtantly ſo poet ſaying naturam expellas c though uſe art violence barre nature yet recurre recurre though violently ſmother keep flame yet ſooner paſſage aſcend becauſe nature doth conſtant invariable true reſpect original ſinne doth conſtantly certainly work u even often ſoul doth put forth vital acting thoſe thing accident ſeldom fall nature frequent may know sunne riſe though night till god put period courſe nature thus concerning man ſoon ever born may conclude child ſoon ever think underſtand ſoon love angry ſinfully even ye ſee young serpent may certainly conclude poiſon ſoon ever ſting reaſon becauſe conſtant pollution ſoul therefore every thing unregenerate man doth gen 6 5 imagination thought man heart evil continually continually becauſe naturally ſo may reſpect alſo make thee jeremiah wiſh thy head fountain tear weep day night thing dreadfull fountain poiſon within running day long flux blood act humane skill ſtop ariſtotle ſaith every time man breath come ſome kind fire certainly every time thou thinkeſt moveſt thy ſoul way come hell fire thoſe motion mean ſeaſhore fuller ſand air atomes thou art conſtant ſinnefull emanation thy ſoul sect v fourthly ſinne natural becauſe would carry man higheſt acting groſſeſt impiety ſay nature doth act alwayes higheſt thus true reſpect natural corruption doth incline every man vile enormous although original corruption doth deprive underſtanding making irrational beaſt yet doth ſo captivate inthrall whole man though underſtand nature yet underſtanding willing ſinfull manner alwayes becauſe corrupted nature therefore would hurry every man even devil swine ſea perdition every one would cain juda corrupt nature left ſelf ask men turned ſo many beaſts devil whole world conſuſion come civility morality every place like hell men thus vile nature anſwered god hath reforming reſtraining grace later may called grace thoſe god reformeth inwardly ſanctifieth made delight law god fear god put heart ſo keep ſinne love god others god layeth reſtraint upon put bridle mouth although inſatiable appetite ſinne put forth whole abundance evil within yet principle inclining thereunto god ſtops balaam whoſe heart deſirous curſe people iſrael though reſtrained ſea natural motion would overthrow whole world god hath put bound ſaying hitherto ſhalt thou go thus god hath ſupreme dominion even ſinfull heart man ſo cannot ſinne much liſteth providence god cui nihil eſt malum auſtin ſaid becauſe turn unto good thanks praiſe man say thy ſelf runne ſame exceſs riot others ſo abominable loathſom many others becauſe better nature come leſs polluted original ſin world becauſe god put limit ſee little acorn contained huge branch boughes length time groweth thus let man alone let opportunity ſinne let god reſtrain quickly ſee incarnated devil reaſon becauſe evil natural withall ſeed evil therefore would hurried committing even adam image god ſeminals every godly action ſo none could ſay adam power ſuch ſuch gracious work thus original corruption ſucceeding room thereof naturally defile ſo hath womb apoſtle james chap 1 14 alludeth thereunto wherein monſtrous deformed ſin may conceived sect vi fifthly natural becauſe neceſſarily greatly aggravate guilt habitually actually voluntarily ſinfull naturally neceſſarily ſo great aggravation god holineſs actually holy naturally yet voluntarily muſt great condemnation actually cannot admitted therefore though ſome grant adam actual ſinne may made becauſe interpretatively yet inherent corruption becauſe particular perſonal ſinne ſo requireth perſonal actual make ſinne ſeemeth ſome plauſible colour attend principle humane reaſon argument philoſophy let u ſee whether light weighed balance sanctuary anſw 1 muſt underſtand ſenſe ſinne called voluntary man could ſinne ſinneth maliciouſly ſin granted moral philoſophers man willeth ſin ſin becauſe bonum either real appearing ſo adequate object underſtanding cannot aſſent thing apparently falſe ſo neither doth chooſe thing manifeſted evil evil imbraceth ſine ſome deceivable good deceiveth ſoul thus adam tranſgreſſed command god ſinne poſitively intend damnation poſterity ſuppoſe knew himſelf common parent received common ſtock mankind willed action ſinne annexed thus wicked man ſinneth doth damnation ſoul formally conſequentially willing guilt doth belong secondly although granted every ſinne muſt voluntary yet auſtin old anſwered ſinne may called voluntary infant becauſe interpretatively adam therefore ſaid ſinne adam may ſaid two wayes 1 way delegation choſen common parent tranſlated wils amongſt men uſual arbitration ſaid arbitrator hath done though may diſlike ſenſe adam actual exiſtence hence 2 adam may ſaid interpretatively god appointing univerſal principle mankind interpreted done equity making appointment one ſinne onely ſhould deprive man whole image god one ſinne doth cannot extirpate habit grace every godly man hath ſinne grace alſo many thing anſweredanſw firſt vain abſurd thing give leave humane reaſonings ſuch thing cannot event diſcovers ſo plain upon adam actual tranſgreſſion deprived image god created adam therefore loſt ſpiritual ſupernatural life need curiouſly diſpute one ſtab ſin could kill certainly even leaſt ſin preſent poiſon would kill immediately god grace prevent secondly one ſinne may ſuddenly deprive ſubject grace hath appeareth plainly thoſe apoſtate angel firſt ſinne thought act diſputed immediately throw divine bleſſed habitation one firſt ſinne glorious angel made immediately black devil true indeed cannot ſay devil original ſinne ſenſe becauſe firſt angel ſinned reſt ſinned wils bound ſtood upon bottom ſinned perſonally voluntarily actual tranſgreſſion though happily might imitation conſent firſt ſinned yet ſee plainly every apoſtate angel one ſinne enough deprive good fill ſuch inveterate enmity goodneſs devil though ſuch natural light conſcience yet able one good work leaſt holy thought thirdly sinne doth expel grace formally ſome call efficiently meritoriouſly alſo expels formally darkneſs doth light diſeaſes ſickneſs death life meritoriouſly deſerving god ſhould deprive u holineſs deny grace u remonſtrants call folly abſurdity ſay sinne expels grace actually meritoriouſly alſo actually need meritoriouſly man actually put eye abſurd ſay deſerveth put man wilfully throw away garment making himſelf naked deſerveth naked theſe inſtances wayes enervate truth ſinne doth thus actually meritoriouſly alſo deprive u grace ſee hainouſneſs one ſheweth ſinne ſelf like poiſon preſently kils odious god ſelf deprive u ſpiritual life yet doth ſo provoke god becauſe god would continue daily grace u beſides though ſinne doth formally expel grace inherent u yet god grace without u preventing cooperating continuing grace without could thing eſpecially chapter cals law ſinne ſin law ſinne law member apoſtle doth ſo ſhall hear anon ſecond place muſt conſider apoſtle cals law ſinne improper abuſive alluſive ſenſe law properly good matter law muſt honeſt juſt becauſe law par juris jus à juſto therefore aquinas ſaith unjuſt law rather violentia leges yea tully ſaith decree neither leges ne appellandae quidem yet scripture ſpeaks unjuſt hurtfull decree called law thus apoſtle cals law ſinne alluding thoſe property effect law hath law god doth regenerate man contrary doth law ſinne natural man sect iii original sinne compared law five reſpects original ſinne therefore may compared law theſe reſpects firſt law doth teach direct lex eſt lux informeth teacheth done thus schoolman make direction firſt thing neceſſary law work grace godly man called apoſtle law mind chapter becauſe grace within man doth teach direct hence 1 john 2 27 godly man ſaid anointing within law god written inward part ſo within well word without taught thus contrary law ſinne natural man doth teach prompt kind evil law ſinne doth indeed teach ought doth wonderfully ſuggeſt kind wickedneſs u cauſe ſee child ſooner able act readineſs runne evil ſinnes ſeen committed eye much dexterity accompliſh deal inſtruction admonition requiſite nurture young one fear lord little enough law god heart would direct teach holineſs ſide child need taught wickedneſs need inſtruct ſinne much artifice cunning evil way ſo law ſinne bred young one fox serpent though teacher yet law nature within grow ſubtil crafty miſchievous wayes thus law ſinne doth every man ingenious wiſe evil ground ere bring forth corn doth need much labour tillage ſelf bringeth forth bryars thorn thus nature ſo fooliſh blind without heavenly education inſtitution cannot bring holy ſelves men ſubtilty ability frame miſchievous thing law ſinne within directs ſuggeſts informeth much evil put upon devil ſay put minde ſuggeſted ſuch thought law ſinne within thee ſufficiently prompt thee evil secondly law doth onely teach doth inſtigate incline preſſeth provoketh thing commanded thus law mind godly man doth greatly inſtigate provoke good like goad ſide like fire bowel muſt good elſe cannot reſt within read david refrained ſpeaking good laſt could hold longer fire break paul 2 cor 5 love chriſt conſtraineth u thus true believer hath principle grace within like law upon cannot otherwiſe muſt obey thus contrary original ſinne natural man like law within provoketh enflameth evil whenſoever holy duty preſſed upon law ſinne ſtirreth againſt make rage apoſtle doth abundantly teſtifie chapter tels u law ſinne warre fight againſt law god lead captive conquered ſubdued againſt godly man find law ſinne ſo powerfull operative wonder men wholly carnal natural finde law ſinne fully prevailing devil herd swine hurried violently ſea without resiſtance devil poſſeſſed ſome body provoked moved many violent ſudden action could gainſay thus doth law ſinne men naturally provoketh inſtigateth turneth ſoul upſide continually preſſing enclining evil make scripture ſay gen 6 imagination thought man heart evil continually thirdly original ſinne law becauſe man bound captivated luſts thereof indiſſoluble union till death thus apoſtle argueth law husband wife ſhe cannot marry another husband life neither married chriſt predominant yea muſt die ere wholly freed fourthly original ſinne called law ſinne within u becauſe injurious command rule hath every man nature indeed moſt explicite formal reaſon called law law onely required directive power ſo counſels admonition law muſt alſo preceptive commanding power ſo law hath vim coactivum compelling force thing done reſpect apoſtle give title law ſinne within u even perſon regenerate man ſad complaint doth make tyrannical power ſinne within man cannot would yea doth would inſomuch cals himſelf carnal ſold ſinne theſe expreſſions ſo great therefore ſome thought could applied godly man ſaid ſeparated chriſt cannot thing therefore ſaid aſleep even dead ſinne ſo infant new born unable help ſelf promote good ſouls therefore muſt laid foundation without humiliation doth goe deep enough lie thou wert ſuch neither thou thy ſelf man world could help thee greatly would afflict thee though neither men angel deliver thee ſpiritual evil yet thou doeſt lay heart secondly densteth power good thereof muſt conceive man indeed miſerably polluted ſuch cannot help himſelf willing heartily deſireth freed bondage groſly polluted thing willeth thing god loveth yea hateth every thing ſpiritual death therefore welcome becauſe alone free body ſinne ſo ſhall never moleſted fourthly original ſinne called body ſinne becauſe maſs ſin lump evil one ſinne ſinne ſeminally ſeemeth moſt formal expreſs reaſon apoſtle giveth name calling body attributing member body one member one part whole compounded thus original ſinne defilement pollution one part ſoul diffuſeth ſelf body ſinne herein doth exceed actual tranſgreſſions reaſon ought grieve mourn body heavier one part actual ſins load upon thee cauſe comprehends thou art never affected pray spirit conviction word look oftner pure glaſs law compare thy univerſal deformity exact purity want phariſaical natural man ſo ſelfconfident truſteth ſo much heart doth ſo eaſily perſwade himſelf god love whereas come chriſtian like paul complaining law ſinne within finding captivating haling whither would much comfort ſuch one work make hope chriſt thinketh none ſo bad devil worſe feeleth himſelf becauſe original ſinne ſuch loathſom dunghill breſt thoſe putrified arm part body cannot endure themſelves would flie themſelves thus becauſe original pollution fifthly original ſinne may called body becauſe inclineth onely carnal earthly bodily thing ſavouring thing god spirit hence called ſo often fleſh becauſe carrieth man fleſhly thing contrary god full enmity rom 8 doth experience confirm take man till renewed grace bent impulſe ſoul ſuch thing alone earthy ſenſual jam 3 17 apoſtle james doth excellently deſcribe nature natural wiſdom earthy ſenſual deviliſh every one nature beaſtly devilliſh body ſinne preſſeth earth hell 1 called 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 holy thing actually holy yea contrary true therefore adam actually holy becauſe habitually holy tree firſt good fruit good adam fall original actual holineſſe latter effect former therefore one becauſe secondly object objected adam made image god like holy holy adam could ſinne would impeceable even god weak cavilanſw though man made holy god yet equality proportion onely angel made holy yet ſinned eſſentially infinitely holy cannot ſinne yea creature confirmed holineſſe god cannot ſinne elect angel glorified saint adam though made holy yet mutable changeable eſtate therefore might ſinne queſt ſay original righteouſneſſe ſo farre defend withſtand devil ſtrongly ſeemed little grace ſo eaſily enſnared satan ſuch little matter enjoyed ſo much fleſh spirit ſpirit firſt propoſition emphatical expreſſion defilement 1 vniverſality subject predication born fleſh fleſh there none exempted great men noble men even king emperor fleſh fleſh 2 vniverſality subject inheſion fleſh come fleſh ſo body ſoul alſo fleſh ſenſe fleſh place meant whole man conſiſting ſoul body unclean impure appeareth oppoſition spirit god effect thereof another emphatical expreſſion uſing abſtract concrete fleſh fleſhly ſpirit ſpiritual ſee propoſition affirmed concerning mankind born natural way humane philoſophy could ever inform u yea wholly contrary viz nature ſoul body nothing fleſh fleſh put vicious ſinfull quality u ſo mind intellictual choiſeſt part ſoul thus condemned well groſs ſenſitive time ſhewed clear text prove univerſal contagion ſinne yet upon weak poor ground would remonſtrants oppoſe therefore fleſh underſtand man ſimply man fleſh blood begotten fleſhly bodily manner ſinfull corrupted saviour argument born man man ſo born spirit ſpiritual unſound argument would prove regeneration muſt man new born meerly becauſe man certainly adam continued ſtate integrity would procreation child yet would neceſſity regeneration saviour therefore giving reaſon muſt new birth ſinfull pollution every one born whereas reaſon give fleſh cannot meant wholly ſinfull becauſe ſay oppoſition spirit would meant wholly ſpirituall whereas orthodox acknowledge conflict spirit fleſh abiding every regenerate man anſwer abſtract put concrete ſpirit ſpiritual ſo subject propoſition born spirit spirit holy spirit god predicate made ſpirit spirit underſtood ſpiritual heavenly nature wrought u although made thus ſpiritual purely abſolutely ſo yet spirit time ſubdue wholly conquer fleſh ſenſe gal 5 chriſts ſaid crucified fleſh luſts thereof although reliques remainder ſtill moſt holy text thus vindicated obſervation men born natural way without image god thereby alſo poſitively polluted made fleſh ſinfull sect ii uſe word fleſh fleſh ſaid luſt againſt spirit ſhall think holy ghoſt ſpeaketh activity working ſinne u ſhould apprehend abſence god image within u let u aggravate hainnouſneſſe ſee scripture doth deeply humble practice evil meer ſimple privation alſo include propenſity evil followeth original ſinne likewiſe meer privation conceive original ſinne innate imbred habit acquired plain vicious moral habit meer negation abſence ſuch virtue • alſo incline diſpoſe ſubject vicious action eaſily delight muſt need attribute much poſtiveneſſe original ſinne vicious acquired habit truth cloſer leproſie infecting u ſuch habit ſoon born twiſted within bowel never wholly ſhaken whereas accuſtomed ſinnes perfectly overcome work regeneration difference acquired habit ſinne original corruption regeneration ſeeing image god put u ſubſtance holy habit contrary habit preſently excluded ſinnes godly afterwords commit former habit ſinne reliques original corruption whatſoever remonſtrants ſay contrary regeneration doth totally exclude original ſinne onely diminiſheth ſtrength original corruption abide ſome meaſure u even carry mortal body u prophet made ſuch impoſſible thing men habituated ſinne converted ſaith leopard change skinne may learne doe well accuſtomed doe evil jerem 13 23 ſhall ſaid u borne evil cuſtomary ſinnes leopard skinne original ſinne like leopard nature laſtly poſitive inclination doth neceſſarily follow privation image god due ſummetry excellent harmony firſt ſoul taken away faculty power ſoul muſt neceſſarily move ſinfully inordinately ſoul man alwayes working one way hath loſt original righteouſneſſe cannot hurried evil take away pillar ſtone liethh preſently fall ground ſpoil ſtrings muſical inſtruments immediately make jarre ingratefull noiſe upon every moving ſoul man ſubject immediately ſuſceptible righteouſneſſe corruption loſe righteouſneſſe natural neceſſity corruption cometh room ſo underſtanding act acteth ſinfully moveth moveth ſinfully may well ſay auſtin pelagian demanding corruption could come u god good nature good quid quaeris latentem rimum cum habes apertam jannam cranny gate door open corruption ſeize upon u sect iv application come anſwer objection let u affect heart labour humbled conſideration poſitiveneſſe efficacy firſt hereby ſee reſtrained ſtopped god know ſhould ſtay ſinne cain judas would prove ſay hitherto goe ſinne fountain within thee would quickly overflow active root bitterneſſe four leaven within thee would quickly make thy life like job body full ulcer noiſome ſores thou art plunged ſame mire filth others doe ſay thou haſt leſſe corruption thou art borne innocent onely god ſtops thee balaam ſuch wickedneſſe thy heart forward enough unto serpent fuller poyſon toad venome thou art ſinne thou wouldſt conſtantly committing ſome ſtop put way secondly ſinne thus poſitive inclining thee thou art admire grace god work contrary inclination propenſity thee thou art brought paul delight law god inward man thy heart pant god hart water delighted ſinne longed nothing ſatisfying fleſh oh admire gracious miraculous work god upon thy ſoul hath made thee differ thus thy ſelfe time thou rejoycedſt thoſe ſinnes matter ſhame trembling thee time thy heart affected good creature thou didſt know deſire god hath made iron ſwimme hath made blackmoor white oh bleſſe god leaſt deſires affection thou haſt time good cometh mind yet flow concupiſcence ſo habitual luſt diffuſed extended farre ſoul hath power motion oh regard luſt bodily ſenſible ſpiritual intellectual luſtings ſoul apprehended heavy load burden original ſinne hath upperſprings netherſprings corporal chanel ſpiritual filth runneth groſs prophane man original ſinne acting carnally bodily heretique proud scholar original ſinne acting mentally intellectually man doth conſiſt two part one viſible inviſible ſo alſo doth original ſinne conſiſt two ingredient bodily part ſoul part ſoul doth poiſon fall inferiour part therefore complain ſinne luſt thy material ſenſitive part look upon ſtrength chief power thy immaterial ſoul part theſe original luſt law ſinne doth conſtantly dwel schoolman call fomes peccati becauſe doth fovere like cinder aſhes keep alive fire ſin within man dangerous damnable much cloſe latent sect viii conſideration concupiſcence reference fourfold eſtate man 5 vve conſider concupiſcence concupiſcibiliy ſpeak principle luſting actual luſting according ſeveral ſtates man may looked upon firſt natura inſtituta inſtituted nature firſt right holy concupiſcence deſiring ſeveral power ſoul good orderly way superiora turpiter ſervire inferioribus inferiora contumaciter rebel againſt ſuperiour part ſhewed next place adam concupiſcence ſenſe inferiour part though deſire ſenſible object yet wholly original ſinne thee yea many time acting working mortiferous peſtilential groſſe ſinners let u proceed part eſſential intrinſecally conſtituent depravation ſaid loſſe god glorious image thereby errorem ſuxiſſe videamur ſucked errour nurſes milk ſee ſpeaketh ſomething like moſes ſaith gen 6 imagination thought heart evil continually although ſame time ſeemeth attribute propenſity evil wicked manner depraved opinion ſaith nature hath given u honeſty parvulos igniculos ingeniis noſtris ſemina innata virtutum although ſome wiſeſt men confeſſed ſuch miſery infirmity upon u yet may doubted whether looked upon truly properly ſinne deſerving puniſhment either god man rather thought ſinne muſt voluntary hence seneca erras ſi exiſtimas nobiſcum naſci vitia ſupervenerunt ingeſta ſunt indeed ſad complaint concerning man birth miſery accompanying auſtin ſaid rem ſcire cauſam neſcire evidently ſaw miſerable knew cauſe whereas original ſin according scripture light though perſonally voluntary yet truly ſinne maketh man damnable eſtate therefore word original divide ſinne original actual terminus reſtrictivus diminuens divide en en reale rationis terminus ſpecificans animal thought perduction ſoul ſtate deſcended body interpreteth ſtate perfection fell old adam ſo even errour ſome truth made tertullian ſay omnia adverſus veritatem de ipsà veritate conſtructa eſſe operantibus aemulationem iſtam ſpiritibus erroris thus ſee wiſeſt heathen divided point making ſoul man come without vice virtue blank fit receive either others acknowledging diſeaſe infirmity upon ſoul yet ignorant cauſe neither acknowledging ſinne ſo deſerving puniſhment ſecond place although heathen ſee ſinne could truly bewail yet ſo farre many convinced ſinfull deſires luſting ſoul wicked thought heart gave conſent theſe ſinnes wholly abſtained though break forth act grotius comment upon 10th commandment ſheweth ſeveral heatheniſh writer ſecret luſtings ſoul conſent thereunto wholly unlawfull yea one ſaid expreſſe ſo much covet needle leaſt thing seneca hath high aſſertions governing thought ordering inward affection ſouls ſo god well men may approve u tully ſaith honeſt man xxii compariſon oppoſition firſt ſecond adam introductory queſtion corruption propagated sect 1 cor 15 49 born image earthy ſhall alſo bear image heavenly apoſtles chief ſcope chapter corroborate eſtabliſh one main fundamental article principle religion reſurrection dead truth fiducia chriſtianorum confidence life believer ſo hath oppoſed denied many moſt abſurd fabulous inſomuch tertullian ſaid concerning chriſt god becoming man crucified u prorſus credibile quia impoſſibile ſame may applied truth therefore object faith becauſe reaſon cannot comprehend among many argument apoſtle ſtatuminateth doctrine chriſts reſurrection moſt palmarious although heathen argument would valid yet corinthian either doubted denied reſurrection wholly abandon chriſtian faith reaſon would cogent corinthian either doubt infidelity point hath made doctrine unqueſtionably true ſo doubt hereſies overruled god make truth orient like file ruſty iron like ſhaking tree maketh root faſter deeper whereas doubt may wherein lieth ſtrength argument chriſt riſen therefore member ſhall riſe muſt know apoſtles argument doe principally prove bleſſed happy reſurrection juſt wicked ſhall riſe power chriſt judge member united head twentieth verſe giveth u twofold reaſon connexion firſt chriſt firſtfruits firſt fruit ſanctified whole crop corn although taken reſt yet aſſure would taken time thus chriſt firſt fruit ſanctifie people reſurrection aſſured pledge ſecond reaſon pertinent matter hand collation adam chriſt adam common root principle death come ſo chriſt common head salvation life apoſtle rom 5 maketh ſuch compariſon adam chriſt two common principle head another purpoſe reſpect ſpiritual death viz sinne one righteouſneſſe principally reſpect temporal death reſurrection chriſt apoſtle thus cleared truth enters ſecond debate viz body ſhall riſe determining •• eth corruptible body ſhall raiſed incorruptible one dieth natural body ſhall raiſed ſpiritual laſt diſtinction natural ſpiritual body ſhould ſeem uncouth abſurd aſſerteth confirmeth scripture ſecond place taketh collation firſt adam ſecond therein compared 1 regard condition state 2 reſpect original 3 reſpect quality property illuſtration apoſtle large becauſe ſtrength argument lieth principle ſuch effect root ſuch branch men adam earthly mortal body die therefore chriſts ſhall heavenly ſpiritual body let u diligently open particular wherein collation adam chriſt made hence ſhall fair occaſion examine adam come thus image upon u great difficulty doctrine original ſinne sect ii firſt particular therefore wherein compared ſtate condition adam chriſt made adam eſtate proved scripture ver 5 written firſt man adam made living ſoul related gen 2 7 god ſaid breath man noſtrils breath life man became living ſoul adam body made duſt formed thencefrom yet without life motion therefore god farre otherwiſe bruit beaſts breathed breath life ſpoken manner men figurative way think god took form chriſt called laſt adam adam becauſe common perſon laſt becauſe ſucceed laſt adam ſaid made quickening spirit chriſt man yea ſuch humane nature adam like thing sinne onely excepted ſpoken chriſt conſcience keeper followeth deſpiſe contemn dictate wofull later end thirdly though conſcience may apply yet doth weakly faintly ſo alſo ſeldom conſtantly daily cock crew twice peter remembred himſelf conſcience may apply twice yet noiſe luſts drown voice therefore unleſſe ſpeak frequently unleſs applying often prophet three time dead child ſpiritual life procured thus conſciences even natural men ſome fit expectation ſome great eminent judgement finde power conſcience upon pharaoh ahab felix trembled paul preaching flaſh like ſudden clap thunder terrifieth preſent paſt preſently forgotten thus fear death ſome powerfull sermon thy conſcience giveth blow ſharp prick thy heart thou art ſome agony ſome terror becauſe conſcience doth often never giving thee till hath recovered thee hence thou returneſt thy old ſtupidity fourthly conſcience naturally doth duty applying neither witneſſing bearing teſtimony action yet one great end conſcience put man ordinarily ſaid conſcientia eſt mille teſtes conſcience thouſand witneſſes ſo indeed doth bear teſtimony man action thouſand world yea mille teſtes mille tortores thouſand tormentor ala ſo defiled many thing thing faileth giveth leaſt true witneſs pollution upon loud voice would cry thee ſaying know god knoweth ſinnes thou daily liveſt little regard witneſs hath appeareth men accompliſh impiety none behold witneſſes confirm men matter witneſs conſcience god bear againſt oh vileneſs thy heart thou runneſt eye men conſidereſt eye god thy conſcience behold thee though indeed thy conſcience moſt part mute ſpeechleſs let thee alone thou wilt witneſs againſt thee bribed rather ſpeaks thee flattereth thee bewail ſinfulneſſe upon conſcience even particular doth bear witneſſe thy evil action doth ſo coldly languidly thou canſt hardly hear voice whereas prophet like external conſcience church lift voice like trumpet inform tranſgreſſions ſpare thus ſhould conſcience thee woe people whoſe paſtor dumb dog leſſe thoſe whoſe conſcience alſo dumb dog though witneſſes teſtimonies conſcience againſt thy ſelf action troubleſom vexatious thou canſt eat drink ſleep yet hopefull may preparatory converſion thy conſcience ſay nothing corruptly bribed ſaying thee thy action abſolom every one came cauſe good theſe cold ſoft whiſperings conſcience afraid thee thou notoriouſly diſcovered acting ſecret ſinne thy iniquity committed ſecretly though thou liveſt ſecret uncleanneſs ſecret thieving coſening thy dealing ſo world doth know thou thinkeſt well thee could conſcience roundly bear witneſs theſe ſecret ſinnes would much ſhame affect torment thee world know thou haſt done private oh conſcience muzzled ſaid demoſthenei would plead clyent pretended quinſie throat argentanginam pati thus thy conſcience hath verbatim apoſtle peter written ſecond epiſtle verſ 4 proclaimeth end put remembrance though knew memory ſake way exhortation underſtandings way inſtruction may gather ſuch weakneſſe ſinfulneſſe memory imagination ſenſitive appetite accordingly becauſe man ſoul like angel body communicateth beaſts therefore hath twofold apprehenſion intellectual ſenſitive underſtanding imagination alſo twofold appetite rational one ſenſitive one ſenſitive appetite man wherein paſſions affection ſeated man rational appetite following propoſition manifeſtation underſtanding man know good evil appetite imbrace one avoid would better ſtone ſtatue reaſon ſee god hath placed ſuch power ſoul good underſtanding manifeſteth may imbraced entertained evil doth diſcover may ſhunned whether diſtinct really ſoul ſelf underſtanding philoſophical diſpute tend edification secondly though appetite man yet rational appetite ſubjected rational ſoul threefold appetite 1 natural motion inanimate thing ſtone deſcend downwards called appetite though properly ſo becauſe doth follow knowledge conſequent upon forme immediately 2 ſenſitive appetite moveth upon knowledge ſenſe beaſts alſo men yea naturally live deſire even motion ſoul according ſenſe ſo reſpect man become like bruit beaſt afterwards 3 rational appetite called man onely beaſt hath properly hath underſtanding ſo man noble high faculty appointed follow reaſon regulated thing therefore auſtin ſaith voluntas tantum eſt bonis good thing man love evil deſire evil voluntas ſaith cupiditas doth deſerve name luſt common ſpeech otherwiſe bad corrupted well good ſay rational appetite muſt underſtood formaliter participativè ſay doth know doth reaſon directed thereby therefore called coeca potentia blind power ſay blind ſee good propoſed anſwer followeth good propoſed becauſe knoweth becauſe eſſential ſubordination underſtanding hence good ſo requiſite ſound mind ignorant blind mind alwayes accompanied corrupt polluted wils cannot ſanctified enlightened mind ſhould make ignorant ſtupid tremble eſtate live ſhould make prize knowledge gold pearl alſo wait upon miniſtery diligence ſeeing knowledge cometh made holy fourthly inform ſelves depravation much noble excellent hotly diſputed two faction thomiſts scotiſts excellent faculty underſtanding thomiſts underſtanding scotiſts theſe two cannot abſolutely every reſpect commended reſpect power efficacy eminent underſtanding ſelf reſpect exerciſe ſubject dominion alſo properly original fountain good evil man though underſtanding hath actual ſinfulneſſe affection yet becauſe either directly indirectly ſo actual deliberate ſinne required ſome kind voluntarineſſe either expreſly interpretatively either ſe causâ original ſinne heard voluntary ſome ſenſe although need judge ariſtotles rule ignorant ſuch thing therefore julian pelagian triumphed ariſtotelical philoſophy againſt original ſinne deſpiſing eccleſiaſtical judge knowing ariſtotles category ſaith auſtin deſired synod peripateticks rather judge church though original ſinne indeliberate motion thereof actual perſonal man yet ſinnes ſo pollution effect pollution whole man hence fifth place difference underſtanding wil relation object underſtanding doth receive ſpecies object ſelf object themſelves therefore know underſtand evil object doth defile underſtanding perfection thus godknoweth evil committed world yet knowledge polluted thereby scire malum non eſt malum goeth object themſelves thereby loving object thus ſinne ſinne know ſin becauſe goeth ſinfull object ſelf ſo keeping keep placed upon preſently becomes like thou loveſt world earth thou art earth thou art world hence ſinne kept though thy mind though ſuggeſtion thee yet becauſe conſent thy ſinne thy miſery ſpeak motus principatus antecedent ſuggeſtions offered without yeeldeth conſencs becometh thy evil immediately poiſon remote part body may kill ſtriketh heart mortall thus ſinne temptation ſinne ſuggeſtion doth deſtroy till receive ſo great matter look power ſoul ſixth place becauſe rule dominion hath therefore called univerſall appetite whole man ſee power ſoul peculiar proper inclination eye ſee ear hear unto ſpiritual object temporal object lay one one ſide ſide yet chuſe temporal let go ſpirituals though temporal tranſitory fleeing away whereas ſpiritual thing would eternal would continue thine ever oh fooliſh unwiſe men make ſuch choice yet ſtate every unregenerate man doth ſay give good thing world though loſe heaven eternal glory let day pleaſure moment profit though eternity loſs torment upon account night thy ſoul ſhall taken away whoſe ſhall theſe thing ſinfulneſſe thy herein never enough lamented till dive thy eye opened hell thou behold choice thou haſt made chriſt giveth mary commendation ſhe choſen better part luke 10 42 ſhould never taken oh alſo could ſaid thee truly thou haſt choſen good part though wicked ungodly world think worſe part would never take yet good part becauſe never taken thee thy grace thy good workes never leave thee goe grave thee heaven thee thirdly ſinfulneſs thy chuſing ſeen thou hadſt rather ſinne become afflicted yet naturally adhering every complaint paul could doe good would becauſe ſold ſinne foundation laid saviour ſhewing difference ſervant ſonne doth text ſuppoſe 1 neceſſity every one till ſanctified made free 2 manner 3 freedom indeed neceſſity ſuppoſed sonne make free though ſpeaketh thoſe jew twofold bondage ſinne original actual natural voluntary yet applyed every man ſtate regeneration hath liberty freedome good vaſſal therefore called redeemer becauſe doth obtain ſpiritual freedome people onely reſpect guilt ſinne freeing grace chriſt pelagians acknowledge would conſtantly interpret text ſenſe onely alſo power ſinne inherent sanctification renovation whole man freedom text doth principally ſpeak ſo much freedom guilt ſinne juſtifying grace power ſinne ſanctifying grace 3 commendation ſpiritual liberty bondage chriſt maketh u free ¶ 3 ſeveral kind freedome scripture ſpeaketh enter depth doctrine conſider kind freedome scripture ſpeaketh applicable purpoſe schooles vaſt diſputes liberty freewill infidel pagan example doth believe becauſe propoſition object miniſtry otherwiſe enjoyed power aſſent even pelagians themſelves follower yea even give grace full due yet thus farre acknowledge muſt paſſive faculty cannot withſtand illumination retaineth indifferency grace hath done therfore granted without grace god enlightning revealing able believe myſteries chriſt kingdom though granted yet forth ſpiritual life man converted without doth believe repent grace god god changeth quickneth enliveneth ſo whereas like sarah dead womb made fruitfull grace god doth compel change water naturally deſcendeth turned air doth naturally aſcend indeed phyſical change moral change grace notable operation conſent therefore grace work grace grace maketh u receive grace hence ſee experience thoſe many enjoy mean grace effectually powerfully improve whence difference becauſe one doth uſe freewill better another surely would attribute farre freewill god grace man maketh grace effectual grace maketh man pliable peter ſhould beholding grace god juda david saul ſeeing ex parte dei grace alike onely one uſed grace god power better another thus ſhall ſomething receive ſhall make ſelves differ derogatory injurious grace god ¶ 10 man naturally love thraldome sinne contradicts mean deliverance great aggravation bondage servitude secondly miſerable bondage ſinne aggravated loveth thraldome delight drudgery even swine doth mire yea doth vehemently oppoſe contradict mean deliverance auſtin complained velle meum inimicus captivum tenebat kept captive grace god come ſet u free love bondage better liberty rather priſon chain upon u abide god palace vaſſalage ſinne like bodily one troubleſome grievous thoſe detained therein ſee iſraelites groaning yoke naturally delight ſlavery look upon freedom grace would procure u greateſt miſery maketh u unſpeakably miſerable according known rule quid miſerius miſero non miſerante ſeipſum miſerable wretched man doth cannot pity himſelf muſt therefore conceive man thus captivated ſin againſt inclination ſelf endeavour caſt yoke ſome people overpowered forced ſubmit yet wait long opportunity ſet themſelves liberty doth delight rejoyce ſervitude man doth willingly give ear boared luſts reſolving never go maſter unleſs grace change make new creature ¶ 11 bondage ſeen concupiſcential affection ſome creature never able lift ſelfe god groſſe ſinnes oh unſpeakable bondage ſinne bird net ſhe ſtriveth get ſhe intangleth ſelf thus natural man ſtriveth himſelf come mire faſter ſticketh thou art natural man though ſuch ſinne ſuch ſinne come divine nature borne theſe place deſcribe man ſpiritual ſenſe blind mind deaf eares hardned underſtanding yea ſay dead ſinne therefore work converſion compared regeneration reſurrection theſe god working grace whereby duty gift although arminian thinketh impoſſible duty becauſe people believe repent commanded thereunto alſo gift becauſe grace god alone doth enable thereunto therefore read ſuch command muſt think imply power ability grace would wholly excluded ſeeing theſe text ſpeak abſolutely good work wholly done power whereas arminian papiſt wholly exclude grace ſo theſe text would prove contend ſuch command ſtill impoſed upon u god ſhew doth belong may juſtly expect u ſeeing created man full power ability keep theſe command man wilfully caſt himſelf utter impotency god hath thereby loſt right commanding though power obeying beſides theſe command know duty ſo thereby alſo provoked deeply humbled great inability ſeeing ſelves treaſuring wrath every day preparing torment man rational agent although work grace meerly ſwaſive efficacious really changing heart ſo spirit god doth farre converting ſinner devil doth tempting ſinne yet god dealeth ſuitably nature man like corporeal nature proportion ſutableneſſe ſpiritual ſupernatural object eye hath immaterial ſubſtances ſo eye cannot ſee ſpirit neither material affection terminate upon immaterial object anſwer affection implanted u hand maid rational part ſubjected eſſential ſubordination therefore thoſe ſuperiour part ſoul ſtrongly imbrace ſpiritual good affection alſo way concomitancy ſtirred therein affection drawn holy duty corrupt motif ſhews pollution thirdly herein alſo apparent original pollution affection moved ſtirred holy duty yet ſpiritual motive draweth ſome corrupt unlawfull reſpect thus world guile hypocriſie affection think love god affecteth u love ſelves glory accompliſh end thus ſorrow think ſinne grieve becauſe temporal evil ſome outward calamity inſomuch conſideration philoſophers affirm beſides rational immaterial faculty ſoul alſo beſides external ſenſes internal material ſenſes number whereof greatly diſſent make five common senſe phanſie imaginative power riſe ſleep uſe imagination preſerve ſpecies ſuggeſted order judge thereby neceſſary underſtanding according rule oportet intelligentem phantaſmata ſpeculari certainly power god admirably ſeen imaginative faculty whether men beaſts bird come ſo artificially make neſts ant bee ſuch admirable provident creature kind natural inſtinct whereby phanſies determined ſuch thing imagination sheep afraid wolf though never ſaw one eſpecially man imagination perfect many admirable thing nature learned men ſaid muſt confeſs ignorance onely muſt know affection potent man turn way way ſo alſo imagination fancy man inſomuch great happineſs ſanctified fancy commonly men womb wherein much iniquity conceived greatly diſputed philoſophy power ſtrength imagination gone ſo farre attribute miracle whether divine diabolical ſtrength imagination yea abilardus poſition fides eſtimatio faith nothing ſtrong fancy theſe abſurd onely granted ſome ſtrong impreſſions may make party himſelf alſo fruit womb conception jacob art laying particoloured ſticks ſheep came watered time gendring might bring ſuch coloured lamb though imagination might ſomething conducible thereunto yet rather aſcribe ſome learned men miracle peculiar bleſſing power god towards jacob ſhall hold longer let u proceed diſcovery natural ſinfulneſs thereof sect iii natural sinfulneſſe imagination appeares making idol daily support vain conceit whereby pleaſeth ſelf firſt metaphorical expreſſion text doth fully declare potter doth make veſſels upon wheel daily ſome explain artificer doth wood material make idol worſhippeth god though vanity thus imagination man doth daily fabricate ſuch fancy idol ſelf making god putting confidence therein obſerve riſeth daily heart man devoid grace ſhall find continual idolmaker maketh daily puppet vain conceit whereby pleaſeth ſelf accounteth ſelf happy therein thus ſee ſhops heart imagination ſinfull artifice make erect idol day long even child naturally delight make baby play ſo men nature many vain idol ambitious men unclean men world daily build fancy hence glorious thing pleaſant thing pleaſe themſelves imagination real poſſeſſion dilated upon mean let u ſadly mourn horrible corruption imaginative part man ſhould daily making new god continually erecting idol apt put confidence lapide 8th chapter verſe 21 like expreſſion metaphor doth offer ntollerable violence ſacred text whereas ſaith imagination ſet evil would make two ſhops wherein imagination doth work ſhop ſinne wherein fabricateth evil ſhop vertue wherein imagineth good thing directly confront text put lie upon let u willing found evil let u acknowledge imagination doth continually ſet vanity idol make ſelves god ſo leave true god made ſome entrance already upon diſcovery wound deadly blow imaginative power man hath received original ſinne wonder managing point often mention thought diſcourſe invention apprehenſions attributing theſe imagination although underſtanding properly power ſoul whence theſe operation proceed yet becauſe heard imaginative faculty ſo near inteliectual operation hath ſome dependance ſo hard know perceive ſome internal part ſoul operation fancy mind though indeed ſometimes reaſon doth correct imagination even ſenſe yea divine philoſophers commonly attribute ſome kind opinion judgement yea imperfect diſcourſe unto difference given common internal ſenſe imagination common ſenſe doth receive ſimple impreſſions thing ſtone bread wax receiving impreſſion ſeal ſeal ſelf image thus doth common ſenſe receive ſpecies thing retaineth fancy doth go higher doth compound theſe ſingle ſpecies together witneſs thoſe many dreames alſo chimeraes many imagine never exiſtence world therefore office hath ſee near underſtanding yea suidas hearing obedience thereby ſignified would diligently hearken maſters command thus chriſt ear opened whole body prepared god thus chriſt ſo ſome reſpect muſt u god muſt prepare fit body u till grace clog u ſuch burden u way heaven let u proceed ſhew ſinfulneſs thereof particular sect iv sinfulneſs body diſcovered particular ¶ 1 inſtrumental ſerviceable soul holy approches god clog burden firſt body inſtrumental ſerviceable ſoul holy approach god clog burden whereas adam abiding ſtate innocency body exceeding uſefull glorifie god body wing ſoul wheel chariot though weighty themſelves yet ableviate help motion onera adjumenta oneranda exonerant thus body adam ſoul ſuch uſefulneſs yet hinderance body ſouls operation heathen complained calling carcer animae sepulchrum animae priſon ſoul grave ſoul ſoul buried body much may chriſtianity complain weight body runne race heaven mezenius noted cruel fact binding dead body live men ſo noiſom ſtink thoſe carkaſſes men tied might laſt die miſerable death truly may repreſented original ſinne fully purged away ſanctification godly complain body ſinne noiſom carkaſs joyned paul cry wretched men ſhall deliver u bondage ¶ 2 doth poſitively affect defile soul secondly body ſinfulneſs doth appear thus privatively ſubſervient helpfull ſoul doth alſo poſitively affect defile ſoul way phiſical contact ſo body cannot work upon ſpirit way ſympathy ſeeing ſoul body two conſtituent part eſſentially man ſoul doth inform body immediate union hence mutual fellowſhip one another mutual reciprocal acting upon one another ſoul greatly affected doth make great change upon body body greatly diſtempered doth alſo make wonderfull change upon mind thereby man fall madneſs diſtractions alſo ſinne pollution mind thus corrupt ſoul maketh body vile corrupt body maketh ſoul ſinful ſo advance ſinne mutual circle cauſality even vapour cauſe cloud cloud diſlolving make vapour thy ſinful ſoul make thy body wicked thy ſinful body heightens impiety thy ſoul ¶ 3 man act according body inclination thereof mind dictate thereof thirdly herein pollution body manifeſted man doth act according body inclination thereof mind dictate thereof body rather ſoul whereas man creation ſoul dominion body made uſe ſoul order inverted original ſinne body prevaileth ſoul ſoul enſlaved propenſities thereof even ariſtotle ſaid homo magi ſenſus quam intellectus ſence underſtanding ſo corporeal ſpiritual man compounded two part nature extraemly differ body duſt vile matter ſuch material god would man formed even firſt make man body ſome admirable quinteſſential matter philoſophers ſay heaven made moſt vile contemptible teach man humility even original moſt abſolute eſtate conſiſtent thus body doth partake beaſts agreeth part man ſpiritual immaterial immortal ſubſtance breathed firſt adam god himſelf herein doth agree angel according theſe two conſtituent principle man doth act either according ſoul body ſtate integrity ſoul predominant like angel particular ſince man fallen body principal chief thereupon become like bruit bea •• living walking according inclination temptation body pſalmiſt obſerved pſal 49 12 man honour abideth like beaſts temptation thereof hence read scripture word fleſh ſo often put ſinful part man ſpirit regenerate part called fleſh becauſe ſo intimately adhering body body ſo much iniquity ſinfulneſs expreſſed thus ſinne called fleſh longer quality polluting u bone corporeal ſubſtance ſeveral bodily ſinnes bred noiſome pudddle body drunkenneſs bodily ſinne vice accuſtomed unto greatly doth body crave importune accompliſhing maketh repentance reformation ſo difficult becauſe ſoaked body ſee food eat mouth ſtomack ſome eaſe exonerated digeſted nouriſhment turned part body cannot ſeparated thus ſinnes come incorporated thee thy body habituated vice requireth much prayer agony much humiliation ſupplication ere ſuch luſt diſpoſeſſed oh bewail thy body thus become enemy ſoul like furnace ſending forth continual ſparks fire tree moiſture ſoftneſs thereof doth cauſe wormes breed laſt deſtroy thus thy body ariſe ſuch luſts laſt thy eternal perdition drunkenneſs ſo uncleanneſs alſo luſt body ſinne conſonant think body ſuch firſt creation ſuch ready inſtrument much bodily wickedneſs yea tempter ſeducer dalilah doth ſo often plunge u ſoul ſinnes root bitterneſs man body firſt ground curſed man reduced fountain hence david pſal 51 humiliation murder doth go cauſe even born iniquity thirdly aggravated incurableneſs though adam power caſt himſelf defiled condition yet power recover himſelf would cure would proceed ſtill impiety water waſh blackmore nature man hence grace god whereby quickened death wholly ſupernatural wonder doting ſet idol freewill begin lay foundation ſuch thing natural pravity man man recover original filth devil reſtore priſtine felicity thy actual ſinnes alone humbled poſſible thee live ſinne alone thou didſt need grace chriſt redeem thee bondage fourthly herein alſo unſpeakably aggravated taketh away ſpiritual ſenſe feeling ſpiritual death ſoul dead men nature reſpect ſpiritual thing therefore though expoſed curſes law yet feel nothing tremble cry help phyſitian ſeeketh u grace find u grace hence think ſuch thing original ſinne u oh heavy temptation given unto think ſuch thing original ſinne ſuch enmity againſt god naturally heart wo man original drink iniquity like water ſay nothing 〈◊〉 exerciſing impiety readily granted bring text declare immediate iſſue original ſinne becauſe man thus abominable nature therefore drinketh iniquity like water doth ſpeak men cuſtom habituated themſelves evil way become like ſecond nature man originally nakedly himſelf till grace god make change upon drink though action doth denote thirſt natural appetite within thus acting iniquity delight content doth neceſſarily ſuppoſe corrupted perverted principle within whence actual evil doth flow thus text fully explained vindicated exception may obſerve man originally corrupted therefore prone ſinne delight becauſe abominable filthy therefore ſwalloweth iniquity like water every man body mortal corruptible principle within expoſeth diſeaſes appetite ſinne never ſatisfied obeying luſts thereof propenſity ſinne expreſſed thirſt provoking man drink delight abundantly like expreſſion uſed job 34 7 man like job drinketh ſcorning like water delighteth doth eaſily findeth reluctancy remorſe upon co •••• ence sect ii much implied metaphor man drinketh iniquity like water illuſtrate let u conſider firſt much implied metaphor text uſeth man drinketh iniquity like water firſt denoted vehement violent appetite ſinne thirſt extream intollerable ſome ſay worſe hunger hence samſon cried thirſt though ſo ſtrong man able bear chriſt himſelf upon croſſe complained pain ſaid thirſt denoteth impetuouſneſs appetite uſually defined appetitus humidi frigidi appetite moiſt cold hunger calidi ſicci hot dry learned voſſius de theol genili lib 3 pag 104 thinketh definition though given ariſtrotle ought corrected becauſe hungry men ſometimes deſire cold thing eat thirſtly ſometimes hot thing drink therefore thinketh exact define hunger appetite humidi pinguis moiſt nouriſhing thirſt humids aquei moiſt meerly ſo ſatisfying thirſt properly nouriſhed thereby meat eat diſpoſed better nouriſhment ſo thereby part body dried watered food eaſily conveyed proper place yea hunger thirſt appetite grief dolor ariſing ſenſe feeling ſtomack though granteth appetite follow grief howſoever philoſophy yet ſee thirſt appetite hath neceſſarily following alſo kind pain grief whereby every part needy calleth relief thus man nature deſtitute image god finding happineſs doth earneſtly crave ſome relief creature thirſteth pleaſures profit bidden god word thereupon whole endeavour ſtudy fulfill luſts ſinfull inclination within ſaid ſome particular ſinners ſome luſts epheſ 4 19 given themſelves work uncleaneſſe greedineſſe alſo jer 8 6 every one turneth courſe viz wickedneſſe horſe ruſheth battel true men naturally reſpect ſome ſinne true thoſe mentioned theſe text beſides natural inclination ſuperadded inveterate habituated cuſtoms impiety ſo firſt ſecond nature alſo hurrying away yet pollution nature alone enough thus precipitate u headlong every evil way thou conſider thy ſelf acquainted pollution upon thee oh drought upon thy ſoul vehement provocation within continually evil secodly vehement inclination thus ſinne reſtleſneſſe diſquietneſſe u till ſatisfied rage oppoſe thoſe give u drink water diſcontented men thoſe mean wayes god hath appointed prevent ſinne love law god love word god becauſe holy threatneth ſinne love faithfull powerfull miniſtry becauſe 〈◊〉 work againſt ſinne cannot endure holy order diſcipl •• 〈◊〉 hath appointed church becauſe againſt ſinne becauſe thirſt within ſcorching heat therefore cannot endure hinred ſatisfying thus mean man put miſerable perplexity doth ſinne mad rageth doth ſinne miſerable undone one dropſie doth drink cannot bear doth thereby increaſeth danger thus every man miſerable reſtleſſe creature nature wretched doth ſinne wretched much doth ſinne miſery ſcorching heat within man nothing cool parabolically repreſented saviour divies hell luke 16 24 deſired abraham ſend lazarus might dip finger water cool tongue though drop water glad thus proportionably every man nature vehement appetite ſinne therefore much diſquieted till accompliſh read terrible judgement god brought upon iſralites wilderneſs deut 8 15 fiery serpent ſling hebrew word serpent ſignifieth thirſt alſo greek name 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 doth anſwer called ſo becauſe upon ſtinging man hath immediately ſuch inflammation heat upon doth thirſt inordinately yet drink dieth irrecoverably ſo man bitten miſerable condition drink heat within burn drink ſure die original ſinne like fiery serpent hath poiſoned mankind ſting ſo man hath inordinate thirſt ſinne ſinne find reſt comfort ſinne damneth himſelf way cure till ſpiritual thirſt put natural thirſt till heart carried delight complacency heavenly thing ſinfull tormenting drought upon ſoul quickly abated diſeaſe called bulimy dogshunger doth bring tormenting pain inward part ſo doth impetuous propenſity unto evil till accompliſhed like wolf breaſt conſumeth continually wiſeman doth fully expreſſe diſquietneſſe ſoul till luſts ſinne fullfilled prov 4 16 ſleep except done miſchief ſleep taken away unleſs cauſed ſome fall thirdly ſimilitude drinking iniquity like water doth ſuppoſe ſweetneſſe delight ſinning although water ſuch hath ſavourneſſe therefore like wine beer yet becauſe cooling doth much delight refreſh refrigerate hot thirſty appetite within hence solomen expreſſeth deſirable news ſimilitude cold water thirſty much muſt man hath corrupt principle within carried ſinne though devil tempt u wicked men hence apoſtle doth text name luſt onely inward cauſe mentioning devil wicked men yet diſputed although luſt man within ſufficient cauſe principle carry man evil whether devil alſo doth help committing every ſinne queſtion whether original luſt cauſe devil alſo doth excite ſtirre think becauſe wicked men within generally ſaid cauſe man ſinne therefore cannot ſay devil tempteth every evil action commit although ſome particular hainous ſins juda ananias sapphira entered heart filled temptation time obſerve peter doth reprove ananias letting satan ſuch admiſſion heart act 5 3 hath satan filled thy heart devil doth compell man ſinne excuſe ſay satan tempted could thy luſt conſent entetain throweth againſt fleſh theſe contrary one ſo ye cannot thing ye would apoſtle verſes admoniſhed uſe liberty ſhould turned licentiouſneſs make love rule thereof though reſpect right chriſtian liberty conſcience regard none god yet uſe exerciſe muſt regulated love prudence according edification brother doth require remedy therefore refrain exceſs therein giveth u excellent precept emphatical introduction thereunto ſay ſumme main theſe caſes antidote ſelf walk spirit way prevent thoſe importunate temptation fleſh give ſelves spirit obtain direction illumination thereof alſo inclination powerfull therefore paul ſaith himſelf though regenerated ſold ſin ſay expreſſions named like paſſive ſenſe active ſenſe thoſe wicked men ſaid ſold themſelves denoteth wilfulnes obſtinacy ſold implieth done againſt captive abſolutely limited fleſh phraſe denote wicked man high degree apply man legal conviction preparatory way converſion would hard ſay ſuch men ſold themſelves evil beſides twofold bondage captivity ſin even iſraelites twofold one born egypt another voluntarily ſin ſell babylon thus bondage unto ſin born adam ſold ſinne ſo needed chriſt redermer ſecondly bondage unto ſinne voluntary tranſgreſſions true regenerate perſon cannot ſold ſinne later ſence former ſo injurious unto grace god auſtin noteth yet mortal corruptible thus great neceſſary truth eſtabliſhed paul ſpeaketh themſelves ¶ 4 ſeveral wayes whereby original sinne doth hinder godly religious progreſs whereby ſinful imperfect next propoſition order fleſh original ſinne man doth ſeveral wayes hinder godly religious progreſs whereby ſinful imperfect whereby every one forced cry nunquam ſapientem ſo nunquam pium oh never godly never believing never anſwering holy law god treacherous enemy within u ſo multiforme putteth ſelf chamelionlike ſo many ſhapes moſt holy men cauſe alwayes guard keep continual watch leſt ſometime daliah betray hand philiſtines poſſible ſome eminent ſervants god david peter yea obſerved philoſophers made chriſtians received laſt article chriſtian faith becauſe ſo contrary thoſe philoſophical principle accuſtomed unto sadduces alſo denied main article might ſuppoſed upon corrupt ground futable luſts though ſo numerous ſo applauded piety people phariſees yet moſt part richeſt moſt wealthy imbraced opinion denied reſurrection convenient carnal heart might delight ſecurity give themſelves preſent world apoſtle doth moſt induſtriouſly powerfully confirm doctrine true chriſtian religion would vain principal argument prove doctrine reſurrection chriſt riſing head neceſſarily followeth member ſhould alſo riſe ſuch glory immortality chriſts reſurrection doth neceſſarily inferre out made primitive chriſtians ſo affected ordianry ſalutations whenmeeting one another uſe ſay chriſtus reſurrexit chriſt riſen end chriſt called firſt fruit ſlept verſ 20 firſt fruit ſanctifie whole harveſt corn afterwards gathered chriſt riſing member reſurrection aſſuring hence apoſtles argument prove reſurrection wicked men ariſe upon another account onely godly member intereſt mediation indeed diſpute whether even wicked men riſe virtue chriſts merit reſurrection
